title: Claim compensation for a criminal injury

details.description: How to claim compensation if you've been seriously injured in a violent crime using the Criminal Injuries Compensation Authority (CICA) scheme
details.more_information:
You’ll need the following:

  • the unique police reference number
  • contact details for the doctor - if you were treated for the injury
  • the name of the person who attacked you, if you know who it was
  • the date of any court case
details.introduction: You can apply for compensation if you, or someone you know, has been hurt in a violent crime in the past 2 years - you’ll need to fill in an online form.
details.will_continue_on: the Criminal Injuries Compensation Authority (CICA) website
details.alternate_methods:
Contact the helpline:

Criminal Injuries Compensation Authority helpline
0300 003 3601

If your application is turned down

If your application is turned down, you can appeal to the criminal injuries compensation tribunal.
